Text:
Grateful to have a White House standing shoulder-to-shoulder with our democratic ally, Ukraine,

And standing up to Putin.

We must carry the mantle of championing democracy — both at home and abroad. https://t.co/qjDQM70C51

May 2022 be our best year yet:
 
A year of progress. Of healing and hope.
 
A year spent with loved ones, old and new.
 
A year that we will remember fondly, forever.

Happy New Year, everyone!

2021 was defined by remarkable challenges and perseverance.
 
And I end this year with an abundance of gratitude:
 
For the health of my family and friends.
For the communities I serve in Washington. 
And for the promise of a better year ahead.

I want to wish a very Merry Christmas to all those celebrating!

May your day be full of joy, peace, and love.

Stay safe, and have a wonderful holiday.

Thank you, @POTUS. Extending the pause on student loan payments is a wonderful holiday gift for millions of people.

The only thing better?

Canceling $50,000 of that debt for every borrower. Now, that would be a Christmas miracle!

Americans elected us to legislate like our future depended on it.

We can’t live up to that obligation by killing action on climate change.

Ending help for children, families, and seniors.

We must find another way to get the job done. 

Too much depends on it.

There’s a lot we don’t know about the omicron variant.
 
But here’s what we do know about the pandemic:
 
Getting vaccinated and boosted is the best way to stay healthy.
 
It’s free. It’s safe. And it’s the best way to protect you and your family.

.@RonWyden and I call for sanctions against mercenary tech companies enabling human rights abuses.
 
By selling surveillance services to authoritarian regimes, they threaten journalists and dissidents.
 
We must stand up to human rights abusers and those who enable them.

Millions of young people will soon have to begin making student loan payments again.

Payments they cannot afford.

We need to continue the freeze on repayments until the pandemic is over. 

Better yet, we should cancel $50,000 in debt for every student.

Last week, Mark Meadows informed @January6thCmte he would not cooperate further – abandoning his duty to country.

Tonight, the House voted him in contempt and referred him for criminal prosecution.

We acted with urgency.

The Justice Department must do the same.

Like so many forms of bigotry, Islamophobia is, tragically, on the rise.

Our Muslim friends and neighbors deserve to feel safe at home and abroad, at school, at work, at worship – everywhere.

Which is why I support a special envoy to root out anti-Muslim hate.

Today, the House holds a moment of silence for the 800,000 lost to COVID-19.
 
If we held one minute for each individual, we'd be silent for a year and a half.
 
Honor their memory by protecting yourself and your loved ones.
 
Please, go get vaccinated (and boosted).

Republican Members of Congress were texting Mark Meadows before, during, and after the insurrection.

None of this is privileged. All of it is damning. All of it must be exposed. 

And if he refuses to discuss it, he should answer for it.

Mark Meadows' decision to stonewall the @January6thCmte has forced us to proceed with a contempt referral.
 
A refusal to appear when subpoenaed by Congress will result in potential prosecution and jail time.

No one is above the law.

My heart breaks for the communities devastated by these catastrophic tornadoes.

I join millions of individuals across the nation in praying for your swift recovery and for the continued safety of your loved ones.

We are with you.

Workers who go on strike to fight for the wages and hours they deserve should never be permanently replaced. Period.

It’s unacceptable for Kellogg’s — or any company — to retaliate and threaten their livelihoods.

A political high court is putting the right to choose in danger.

Playing games with Roe as Republicans desperately seek new ways to control women’s health.

We can’t let them.

Losing the right to choose will place thousands of women at risk.

Yesterday, a Republican said he’d be excited if I would share the facts of Trump’s Russia collusion with him.

I was more than happy to take him up on his offer.

He was less happy when I did. https://t.co/D74zC044at

By passing the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act, the House has delivered an unequivocal message:
 
Our democracy is worth fighting for.
 
Now, the Senate must show the same conviction to root out corruption and end presidential abuses of power.
 
The price of inaction is calamity.

Protecting our democracy must be a whole of government effort.

Because the task before us is much bigger than any one branch, person, or party.

It’s going to take all of us to get the job done.

I’m grateful to the @WhiteHouse for supporting the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act.

Today, the House will take up the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act.
 
It will root out corruption, curtail presidential abuses of power, and strengthen our system of checks and balances.
 
Our democracy is in a moment of great peril.
 
Time to do something about it.

Before I log off, I want to cover how the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act will strengthen the emoluments clauses of the Constitution. 

@RepRaskin, can I tap you in for this one?

Hi folks.
 
I've got some time, so I'll be taking a few minutes to respond to your questions on the Protecting Our Democracy Act.
 
Drop a question below or use #ProtectingOurDemocracy and I'll do my best to answer as many as possible. 👇 https://t.co/SyiNPZ1mjr

The House votes on the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act tomorrow.

A bill I wrote with @RepCohen, @GerryConnolly, @RepDean, @RepJeffries, @RepTedLieu, @RepKatiePorter, @RepRaskin, @RepMGS, @RepSpeier, @RepSwalwell, & @RepAnnaEshoo.

We're ready to get this done.

Democracy demands it.

The House is set to vote on the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act - legislation to root out corruption and protect against abuses of power.
 
These reforms will help secure our democracy. And today, I’ll answer your questions on PODA. #AMA, and I’ll bring in some House colleagues too!

Tonight's vote paves the way for increasing the debt limit, so we can pay the bills we’ve already incurred.
 
Playing games with the faith and credit of the U.S. could cost millions of individuals their jobs.
 
That's what's at stake here.

The GOP would do well to remember that.

Today, the @January6thCmte learned that Mark Meadows will not further cooperate.

Why he can discuss Jan 6 in a book, but not with Congress, is inexplicable. His deposition will proceed as planned.

If he fails to appear, he will be subject to criminal contempt.

As Hanukkah comes to a close, I’m wishing everyone observing in California and beyond a joyful, peaceful evening of celebration.

Enjoy your last round of latkes and sufganiyot — and above all else, the time with family.

Have a wonderful night.

Trump put a target on the backs of two nonpartisan election workers.

Both got death threats. It’s sick. Sadly, I know what it’s like to be threatened because of Trump’s lies.

After Jan 6, people need to wake up to the threat of political violence.

It’s real - and increasing. https://t.co/43d7DYtwOL

The House just averted a government shutdown.

This continuing resolution will ensure that we uphold our promise to workers, families, veterans, and seniors.

And it will allow us to stay focused on passing critical legislation like expanding child care and improving health care.

The Jan 6 committee just voted to recommend the House hold Jeffrey Clark in contempt. 
 
Clark has direct knowledge of Trump’s efforts to utilize the DOJ to prevent a peaceful transfer of power.
 
By refusing to appear, he's violating the law. He will be held accountable.

It's time to say "no more" and mean it.

No more families with empty chairs at their kitchen tables.

No more missed graduations and weddings.

No more broken communities.

No more trauma. No more violence. No more death.

We have the power to break the cycle.

Let's do it.

5/5

Getting these laws through the Senate may seem difficult.

It doesn't have to be. The difficulty is of our own making. And a belief that an archaic rule is more important than our children’s safety.

If we end the filibuster, we can pass these gun safety laws and more.

4/5

Then, we must hold gun manufacturers accountable when they act negligently.

I have a bill that will put an end to the liability shield allowing manufacturers & dealers to get away with murder.

We should give victims their day in court.

(President Biden supports it, too!)

3/5

First, we should enact commonsense measures that already enjoy broad support:

-Universal background checks.
-Closing the "Charleston" loophole.
-Banning assault-style weapons.
-Red flag laws to keep guns away from abusers.

These are the bare minimum. Not the end.

2/5

Yesterday, yet another horrific act of violence changed a community forever.

It doesn’t have to be this way. And yet it is.

Because Republicans refuse to act.

We have the power to end the scourge of gun violence.

Here’s how we can start:

1/5

PrEP and PEP are highly effective at preventing HIV.

But too often, these medications are out of reach for those who need them most. 

That's why I just introduced legislation to make these life-saving medications available to all in need.

Because everyone deserves protection. https://t.co/QGal0zuo8B

Today, the Supreme Court considered a case that could ultimately overturn Roe.

A “conservative” court would uphold precedent. But a “partisan” court may not — and this may be the most partisan court in history.

We must protect a woman’s right to choose.

I'm closely monitoring the news out of Oxford, Michigan.

And I am praying for the survivors and victims of this horrific attack.

It's every parent's worst nightmare. And a devastating reality for far too many.

Gun violence is killing our children.

Mark Meadows has a legal and moral obligation to cooperate with our committee.

I’m glad he has now agreed to appear and has already provided documents. 

We will evaluate the extent of his compliance after his testimony. 

We must reveal the full truth of what led to January 6.

During Hanukkah we celebrate the many miracles in our lives with the ones we love most.

And tonight, millions of families will light the first candle on their menorah and welcome in this special holiday.

So from my family to yours: Hanukkah Sameach!

Wishing you all a happy, healthy Thanksgiving.
 
Today, I'm thankful for the everyday things: Meals shared with family. Long hikes under blue skies. The health of loved ones.
 
I hope your day is also filled with blessings and joy.

What’s actually in the Build Back Better Act?

🖍 Universal pre-k.
👪 Affordable, quality childcare and paid family leave.
🏘️ Rental and down payment assistance.
🌎 Clean energy investments and climate action.

It will cut your costs and help your family. And it’s just the start.

Our justice system too often fails Black individuals.

But today, truth prevailed and Ahmaud Arbery’s murderers are being held to account.

We know this verdict won’t erase the grief of Ahmaud’s family and friends.

But I pray it will bring comfort to know justice was served.

It's impossible to overstate the magnitude of this moment.

We just passed this generation's New Deal. 

It will help every family. In a big way.

This is a promises made, promises kept moment.

Democrats have delivered for the country. And for the people.

I just voted YES on President Biden’s Build Back Better agenda:

Establishing universal pre-k.
Lowering prescription drug costs.
Expanding family leave.
Protecting our planet.
Expanding health care. 
Cutting child poverty.

The Senate must act. Without delay.

Good morning!

It’s a beautiful day for the House to make the biggest investment in the American people since the New Deal.

I’ve had my caffeine. And I’m ready to vote yes. 

Let’s do this.

If you took the worst orator in the world

Gave him the worst speech in the world

And made him read it for the longest time in the world 

That would be a lot like listening to Kevin McCarthy tonight. 

Except, probably better.

Building Back Better isn't just a slogan.

It's a promise.

A promise of expanded, affordable health care.
A promise of climate action and green jobs.
A promise of paid leave and child care.

A promise of a brighter future – for everyone.

We must make good on that promise.

Paul Gosar made a video about killing one of our colleagues.

That’s just wrong. But the GOP thinks otherwise.

Hell, they’re more upset about members who voted for a BIPARTISAN infrastructure package.

In any other workplace, he’d be punished or out. 

Should be the same here.

Two million students go to school without the glasses they need.

How can kids succeed if they can’t see the board at the front of the classroom?

Today @RepJahanaHayes & I introduced a bill to bring no-cost optometry care to students.

Because every child deserves to thrive.

President Biden just signed the infrastructure deal. 

And let me just say: It’s a big deal.

Roads and bridges, yes. But also clean water, broadband and climate investments.

We need to keep up the momentum, and pass the Build Back Better Act. ASAP.

Nothing less will do.

If our law is to mean anything, it has to be applied equally.

Steve Bannon’s indictment is a badly needed affirmation of that principle. And Congress’ oversight power.

It sends a clear message to every prospective witness:

Refusal to obey a subpoena is not an option. https://t.co/isPjTflP8v

A grand jury just indicted Steve Bannon for contempt of Congress.

Let this send a message to all those with knowledge of the attack on our democracy:

The days of defying subpoenas with impunity are over.

We will expose those responsible for Jan 6.

No one is above the law.

Veterans and service members are the best of us.
 
Their selfless commitment to defending our country deserves nothing less than our utmost respect and gratitude.
 
So on this Veterans Day, let's all join together to thank these brave individuals for their service and sacrifice.

After Columbine, the NRA faced a choice: reckon with their role in a massacre or double down.

We know what they chose.
                                          
231 school shootings later, they're running the same play:

No remorse. No accountability. No regard for human life. https://t.co/N700LC3vQq

There was a time when making light of murdering a colleague would elicit unified outrage.

But not in McCarthy’s GOP.

In McCarthy’s GOP they want to punish members who voted for infrastructure.

That’s right, infrastructure.

But condoning violence — that’s A-okay.

It’s sick.

– Funds to repair crumbling roads & bridges
– Broadband access for students & rural communities
– Green energy infrastructure investments
– And much more

And it's just our first act.

We're committed to passing the Build Back Better agenda to complete the investments in people.

This $1 trillion investment in infrastructure will reach all communities, both big and small, creating a stronger economy that lifts up workers and families.

It will mean:

– Clean drinking water for all
– Largest-ever investment in transit
– Two million new good-paying jobs

Last night, the House passed the bipartisan infrastructure package. It’s on its way to the President’s desk.

There’s no understating the importance of this moment.

This is a historic investment – the first chapter of a new, New Deal, that Democrats are writing for this country.

I just voted yes on the infrastructure package. It will benefit millions of workers and families. 

But unless we invest in our people too, the job is not even half finished.

We can’t stop until we pass the Build Back Better Act.

We need a new, New Deal.

We’re on the verge of passing bills that will benefit every single person in this country.

So naturally, Republicans are trying to adjourn Congress before that happens.

If they want to sit this out, so be it.

But Democrats showed up to work today. And we’re getting this done.

Today’s job numbers show our recovery is continuing. 

And once we pass the Build Back Better agenda, we’ll create even more good-paying jobs.

2 million of them.

Jobs in clean energy, IT, infrastructure, and child care.

Jobs that will change lives and bring us into the future.

Time for a reality check:
 
Senate Republicans will NEVER vote to protect voting rights.
 
We have to stop waiting for the fever to break. It’s time to end the filibuster and start legislating like our democracy is on the line.
 
Because it is.

Domestic terrorism is one of the gravest threats to America.

But we cannot separate that threat from the white supremacist movement that often fuels it.

We must break the cycle of radicalization, and keep America safe — for everyone. https://t.co/8UvK5KLW5V

Look, I get it. It’s easy to be cynical these days. But we have a lot to be hopeful about.

We’re going to pass a New Deal-level investment in people.

We’re going to put our children and grandchildren on a course for a better future.

We’re going to get this done. We have to.

Democrats have been working for years to lower our nation’s unconscionably high prescription drug prices.

Pharma has fought us every step of the way.

And now, we are — at long last — on the precipice of delivering real relief.

This is how you truly Build Back Better.

An election is an election, whether for candidates or ballot measures.

That the FEC would allow foreign money and interference in our elections is utterly incomprehensible. 

It would set a dangerous precedent ripe for abuse.

Americans must decide American elections.

If you've ever had a pet, you know how special the bond is between families and their four legged friends.
 
And how devastating it is when that tie is broken.
 
My Pets Belong with Families Act would end the impossible choice between beloved companions and secure housing.

The climate crisis is the single most dire threat we face.
 
Now is the time for aggressive action.
 
President Biden just showed the world the U.S. recognizes the urgency of this moment.

And the unimaginable peril that lies ahead should we fail.

Let's get this done.

The GOP's flirtation with white supremacy didn't end after January 6.
 
No. It's at the core of their efforts to overturn our democracy.
 
It fuels their media ecosystem. It energizes their base.
 
And unless they cast it out, it will take hold of their party for good. https://t.co/ldTUqMLpwj

The GOP calls Build Back Better a "liberal wish list."

What they’re really saying is they’re against paid family leave and childcare, health care, and climate action.
 
As for me, I don’t view this as a wish list.

It’s a to-do list — and one that needs to get done right now.

The Facebook Papers are shocking and yet, not surprising.

The industry is built on engagement, which grows with anger and hate.

They have a multi-billion dollar incentive to stay the course.

And with over 35% of the world using their platform -

What could go possibly wrong?

Federal law protects against discrimination in housing, schooling and employment.

Health care, however, remains broadly unprotected.
 
That omission costs lives.
 
Our #EqualHealthCareforAll Act makes health care a civil right, ensuring equitable care for all.

Holding Steve Bannon in criminal contempt was an early test of our democracy’s recovery. 

Now, it is in the hands of the Department of Justice. 

To do justice. https://t.co/isp9KkW121

Today, the House found Steve Bannon in criminal contempt for defying a subpoena.

That charge will now be sent to the Justice Department for prosecution. 

The DOJ should take the matter before the grand jury without delay and bring Bannon to justice.

No one is above the law.

Today Senate Republicans blocked a bill to expand the right to vote, end partisan gerrymandering, and expose dark money in politics.

They wouldn’t even allow debate.

Why?

Because Republicans know that when people vote — they lose.

It’s as simple as that.

Steve Bannon was given every opportunity to comply with a lawful subpoena.

He chose instead to make specious claims of executive privilege.

Tonight, we voted to hold him in criminal contempt.

Despite what he and Trump may believe, no one is above the law.

General Colin Powell was a man of deep intellect, courage and patriotism, whose life was defined by service to country. 

America will miss him dearly – but his incomparable legacy will live on. 

My prayers are with his family and friends, and those he inspired to service.

This isn’t a “moderate” vs. “progressive” thing.

This is a “survival” vs. “complete and utter catastrophe” thing.

Reconciliation might be our last, best chance to fight climate change through transformative investments.

The next generation looks to us.

We can’t let them down.

Here’s why this matters:

The Biden Administration has already waived executive privilege on many documents, and allowed top former DOJ officials to testify.

Now Biden supports strong enforcement of lawful subpoenas.

Accountability is back, along with the rule of law. https://t.co/vK5xnflNDW

A minority can use the Electoral College to elect a president who loses the popular vote.

A minority can gerrymander control of the House.

A minority can stop the majority from governing the Senate.

Does that sound like a successful democracy to you?

We’ve said it before, and we’ll say it again:

We’re not messing around here.

People with relevant information to our investigation into January 6 must comply with lawful subpoenas.

If they don’t, we will use all the tools at our disposal — including criminal contempt.

You’ve probably heard a lot about the reconciliation debate.

But chances are you haven’t heard what’s actually IN the bill:

- Paid family medical leave.
- Childcare.
- Lower drug prices.
- Expanded Medicare.
- Climate action.

And so much more.

Enough noise. Let’s get it done.

Tonight, Democrats voted to avert a default, which would have sent our economy into a tailspin.
 
Republicans instead proved they’re just fine with chaos, even a default – and the harsh consequences to families – if it moves them closer to power.

History will not be kind to today’s Republican Party.

A party whose members endorse sedition.

A party that lionizes insurrectionists.

A party that eagerly blocks progress on everything from climate to health care.

So much for the party of Lincoln.

Thanks for the shout-out, Mr. Former President.

As for your statement that the attack on the Capitol would never have happened if “the people in charge had done their job”

You do realize that you were in charge on January 6th? Right?

Just checking.

It’s a simple question with a simpler answer: Was the 2020 election stolen from Donald Trump?

No. Unequivocally no.

But Republicans are so beholden to their disgraced demagogue that they dare not speak the truth.

They are an authoritarian cult. And a danger to our democracy.

Proud to join @POTUS yesterday as he signed my bill, the HAVANA Act, into law.

Every day, brave diplomats, intelligence officers, and servicemembers make great sacrifices.

We must care for them as we investigate these troubling incidents and hold those responsible to account. https://t.co/mqcSOYfSeO

The former president is still trying to stonewall subpoenas.

But this time, we have a Justice Department devoted to the rule of law.

This time, lawbreaking witnesses must weigh the prospect of criminal prosecution.

Americans deserve answers. We will make sure they get them. https://t.co/19Ls6aYNhp

Donald Trump tried to overturn the 2020 election.

He weaponized our government against the American people. And the worst part? He almost succeeded.

Republican leaders in Congress know all of this.

They just don’t care. And they continue to stand by as his attacks continue.

A federal judge just affirmed what so many of us already knew:

Texas’s abortion ban is morally wrong — and legally wrong.

This marks important progress in the ongoing effort to protect the right to choose. 

We will not go back. https://t.co/yTLKpRuVCb

Four of Donald Trump’s associates have been subpoenaed to testify about January 6.

If they refuse to comply, they can be subject to criminal contempt.

What are they hiding? What are they afraid of?

The truth will come out. We will make certain of that.
They. Tried. To. Kill. You. Mister. Vice. President. https://t.co/K6xsd2oBpr

Today, @IATSE members voted to authorize a strike.
  
This is the next chapter in their efforts to secure living wages and better working conditions.
 
It is my hope an agreement can be struck soon, and that this will lead to badly-needed changes for these talented individuals.

According to this Facebook whistleblower, shutting down the civic integrity team and turning off election misinformation tools contributed to the Jan 6 insurrection. 

The Select Committee will need to hear from her, and get internal info from Facebook to flesh out their role. https://t.co/b9ZLhf9lMX

The death of our democracy begins with deliberate attacks on truth.

The erasure of norms and elimination of checks and balances.

We can’t allow our democracy to falter. We must shore up our institutions against those who would destroy them.

#ProtectingOurDemocracyAct. https://t.co/9SVCs7ea7o

Behind-the-scenes workers are the heart of the entertainment industry.
 
Yet their work often goes unrecognized – and should be fairly compensated.
 
Living wages and humane working conditions must be the standard.
 
We must have dignity and respect for all. https://t.co/5eWtHwwg7i

I'm in awe of my colleagues, Cori, Barbara, and Pramila, for sharing their personal stories.

They have shown such courage and strength by speaking out.

Their truths are a powerful statement on why we can't lose an inch in the ongoing fight to protect the right to choose. https://t.co/6CSx3K8IHK

Democrats will make sure we don’t default on our debt.

GOP leaders in Congress just don’t care. 

They will torpedo our economy if they think it will help them. 

It won’t. It will just harm the American people.

The GOP must never be allowed to govern.

Because they can’t.
